issues.title: Clarify the use of the NDP option
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body:
It should be discussed where the NDP option is supposed to be included. Should it only be sent in Router Solicitations? Or could it be used in other message types as well:

- Neighbor Solicitation (type 135)
- Neighbor Advertisement (type 136)
- Redirect (type 137)

My current impression is that these message types are not suitable for MUD URLs, but I might be wrong here.

issues.title: New link relation type for external MUD URLs?
issues.author: JKRhb
issues.body: It could be useful to have a dedicated link relation type for MUD URLs. This way, MUD URLs pointing to a MUD fileserver could be linked like so: `<https://www.example.com/mudfile>;rel="mud";rt="mud";anchor="/"`. In this example, an anchor parameter with a value of `"/"` is used to indicate that the root resource (and therefore the device as a whole) is described by the MUD file the link is pointing to. Maybe the relation type `describes` could also be used instead.
